description:
denoting direction (not properly motion, as אֶל) towards,
    or reference to; and hence used in many varied applications, in some of which the idea of direction
     predominates, in others that of reference

senses.description: very often, with various classes of verbs, to, towards, for
To denote the object of a verb

of a transition into a new state or condition, or into a new character
    or
    office

defining those in reference to whom a
        predicate
        is affirmed, hence often =
